{"step_by_step_thinking": "Sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG) is a protein that binds to sex hormones such as testosterone, estrogen, progesterone, and DHEA. When SHBG levels change, it can affect the availability and activity of these hormones. Testosterone is primarily bound to SHBG, so any change in SHBG levels will have the greatest impact on testosterone. Therefore, the hormone that will be affected most after the change in sex hormone binding globulin is A. Testosterone.", "answer_choice": "A"}
